item.title: Report E-2024040467
item.description:
Report E-2024040467

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-24T15:12:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-09
  • City: OKLAHOMA CITY
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 9, 2024, one (1) 350-gallon tote of acetone had a faulty valve and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Lone Star Hazmat (LSH) to remediate the impacted site. Crews transferred the remaining contents of the damaged stainless steel tote into six (6) 55-gallon steel drums and labeled not to ship. The impacted surfaces were remediated with absorbents and all waste collected and contained in one (1) 55-gallon drum. All waste and the empty tote were staged onsite at the terminal.

Report X-2024040922

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Found at belt five with container soiled. Internal contents have loose caps causing internal leakage.. DescribePack: Box soiled on the top and loose caps. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I quickly cleaned up the surrounding area and placed materials into a clear hazardous waste bag and into a red tote.

item.title: Report E-2024040452
item.description:
Report E-2024040452

Identified by scraper @ 2024-04-19T15:12:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-17
  • City: SEPULPA
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released to a 5’ x 8’ area of the trailer floor a due to a forklift puncture. The damaged pail, impacted absorbents, and PPE were containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.
